channel.title: Projects on Portfolio website for Beatriz
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Portfolio website for Beatriz

item.title: Covid-19
item.description: covid_data <- read_excel('C:\\Users\\beatr\\OneDrive\\Ambiente de Trabalho\\owid-covid-data.xlsx') covid_data_new <- covid_data %>% transform.data.frame(`date` = as.Date(`date`)) Plots plot1c <- covid_data_new %>% filter(`location` == "Portugal") %>% ggplot(mapping = aes(x = `date`, y = `total_cases`, color = `location`)) + scale_x_date(date_breaks = "2 month") + geom_point() + theme(panel.background = element_rect(fill = "lightblue", colour = "lightblue", size = 0.5, linetype = "solid")) + scale_colour_manual(values = "grey50") plot1c plot2c <- covid_data_new %>% filter(`location` == c("Portugal", "United Kingdom", "World")) %>% ggplot(mapping = aes(x = `date`, y = `total_cases_per_million`, color = `location`)) + scale_x_date(date_breaks = "2 month") + geom_point() + theme(panel.

item.title: Main indicators
item.description: World_data <- read_excel('C:\\Users\\beatr\\OneDrive\\Ambiente de Trabalho\\World data.xlsx') World_data_new <- World_data %>% rename("Population" = `Population, total [SP.POP.TOTL]`, "Year" = `Time`, "Country" = `Country Name`, "GDP" = `GDP (constant 2010 US$) [NY.GDP.MKTP.KD]`, "GDP_Growth" = `GDP growth (annual %) [NY.GDP.MKTP.KD.ZG]`) %>% transform.data.frame(`Population` = as.numeric(as.character(`Population`)), `Year` = as.numeric(as.character(`Year`)), `GDP` = as.numeric(as.character(`GDP`))) portugal_data <- World_data_new %>% filter(`Country` == "Portugal") Plots plot1 <- portugal_data %>% ggplot(mapping = aes(x = `Year`, y = `Population`)) + geom_line() + theme(panel.

item.title: Real Estate
item.description: Residential_data <- read_excel('C:\\Users\\beatr\\OneDrive\\Ambiente de Trabalho\\Residential Property Prices.xls') Residential_data_new <- Residential_data %>% rename("%_change" = `Residential Property Prices, Percent Change, Annual, Not Seasonally Adjusted`, "residential_prices" = `Residential Property Prices, Index 2010=100, Annual, Not Seasonally Adjusted`) Plots plot1r <- Residential_data_new %>% ggplot(mapping = aes(x = `observation_date`, y = `%_change`, color = Country)) + geom_point() + geom_line() + theme(panel.background = element_rect(fill = "lightblue", colour = "lightblue", size = 0.5, linetype = "solid")) + scale_colour_manual(values = c("black", "grey50")) plot1r plot2r <- Residential_data_new %>% ggplot(mapping = aes(x = `observation_date`, y = `residential_prices`, color = Country)) + geom_point() + geom_line() + theme(panel.

item.title: Tourism
item.description: Load the data Tourism_data <- read_excel('C:\\Users\\beatr\\OneDrive\\Ambiente de Trabalho\\tourism.xls') Tourism_data_new <- Tourism_data %>% rename("Accomodation_type" = `Accomodation type`, "Overnight_stays" = `Overnight stays`, "Accomodation_type" = `Accomodation type`) %>% transform.data.frame(`Year` = as.numeric(as.character(`Year`)), `Overnight_stays` = as.numeric(as.character(`Overnight_stays`))) Plots plot1t <- Tourism_data_new %>% ggplot(mapping = aes(x = `Year`, y = `Overnight_stays`)) + geom_point() + facet_wrap(~ Accomodation_type, scales = "free_y") + theme(panel.background = element_rect(fill = "lightblue", colour = "lightblue", size = 0.5, linetype = "solid")) + labs(y = "Overnight stays") plot1t Source:

item.title: Visiting Portugal
item.description: About Portugal… Portugal is one of Europe’s oldest extant nations, an ancient kingdom defended by hilltop castles and dramatic walled towns. When you travel to Portugal for the first time you will most likely be struck by the friendliness of the people, affordable food and wine, and the diversity of a country that is relatively easy to travel around in just a few days. It is a landscape of beaches and high mountains, but also of deep, verdant valleys and rolling hills dotted with stone-built villages.

item.title: Wine
item.description: Wine_data <- read_excel('C:\\Users\\beatr\\OneDrive\\Ambiente de Trabalho\\Wine.xls') Wine_data_new <- Wine_data %>% rename("Wine_production_hl" = `Wine production (hectolitre)`) %>% transform.data.frame(`Year` = as.numeric(as.character(`Year`)), `Wine_production_hl`= as.numeric(as.character(`Wine_production_hl`))) Plots plot1w <- Wine_data_new %>% ggplot(mapping = aes(x = `Year`, y = `Wine_production_hl`)) + geom_point() + facet_wrap(~ Localization, scales = "free_y") + theme(panel.background = element_rect(fill = "lightblue", colour = "lightblue", size = 0.5, linetype = "solid")) + labs(y = "Wine production (hl)") plot1w
